subject: Gardening
title: The Pesticide Treadmill
description: Learn The Pesticide Treadmill in one minute.

hook.text: Use a pesticide. Pests develop resistance. Use a stronger one. More resistance. The cycle never ends.

buildup.text: Natural selection ensures that the few pests surviving a pesticide pass on resistant genes.

discovery.text: Over 600 insect species have developed resistance to at least one pesticide class. Some resist all available chemicals.

twist.text: Pesticides also kill pest predators. When the resistant pest rebounds, its natural enemies are gone.

climax.text: The pesticide treadmill creates dependency. Escape requires rebuilding ecological pest control from scratch.

punchline.text: Pesticides create the problem they're supposed to solve.

quiz.question: How many insect species have developed resistance to at least one pesticide class?
